Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed, outside reserved; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer Identifies the sherd as possibly belonging to a Type 9A or Type 9B South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9A cand Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18) and Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus, the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 51, no. 168)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.523) (Phase 3)
